title: Routine
description: Defines all fields in a routine that users can attempt in SnookerUp

id.description: The ID of the routine, typically the title of the routine in lower case and kebab case.

descriptionLines.description: A description of the routine, as an array of lines

variationsLinesEasier.description: A description of variations that could make the routine easier, as an array of lines

variationsLinesHarder.description: A description of variations that could make the routine harder, as an array of lines

titleImage.description: The headline image filename for the routine (matching the file in src/main/resources/static/), typically more of a thumbnail, smaller resolution image, in landscape

otherImages.description: A collection of image filenames (matching files that exist in src/main/resources/static) that illustrate how to set up the routine, typically in portrait

tags.description: A collection of tags/labels that describe the routine and can be used by users to search

unit.description: The unit to use, when the routine supports configurable number of balls/reds

variations.description: An object containing all the possible ways a routine can be modified to vary the purpose or difficulty

loop.description: Whether the routine supports looping, e.g. complete the routine then set up again and continue where you left off, where the score would be the number of completed loops.

cushionLimit.description: Whether a cushion limit can be applied to the routine, e.g. complete the routine with a maximum number of times the white can hit the cushion.

unitNumbers.description: If the routine supports a configurable unit (reds/balls), define them here.

potInOrder.description: Whether this routine supports the balls being potted in a specific order, where the order is up to the user.

stayOnOneSideOfTable.description: Whether this routine supports a requirement for the white to always stop on one side of the table (typically left/right rather than top/bottom).

ballStriking.description: The different types of ball striking supported by this routine. If not specified, the player can decide.
